intro: Pankea bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate pankea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale pink in color. Pankea bracteata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is not widely cultivated outside its native habitat.
